channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Two men from The Villages admit to casting multiple ballots in 2020 election. https://t.co/LOuNWy8erl
What is an infinite loop? https://t.co/0evGJaL79K

This quote from @cdixon is fascinating. I can put my Twitter screenname in my RSS feed, or an identifier from Etherium, are where ever you like, and form your presence on that net with an RSS feed. It‚Äôs a strong foundation. https://t.co/G0pvdqdglB
In fact if you look at my RSS feed, you'll see there's a slot for the user's ID on various systems. It's part of a namespace I used to extend the format. https://t.co/X5dfcA1wrR
@jeffjarvis Yes all those things on a timeline, until now it‚Äôs fully democratized. The dish is on my porch right now. üòÄ

Playing with my STARLINK network and realize when I was a child, the miracle of a news program with an interview from the other side of the world that was coming thru a satellite. Now it‚Äôs just an internet connection on my iPad.
It‚Äôs a lot like going from a printing press to a personal laser printer in one lifetime.
In high school I published a personal newspaper, with friends, first on mimeograph machine and then on an offset press. Thirty years later, on the web.
'Jack Dorsey's First Tweet' NFT Went on Sale for $48M. It Ended With a Top Bid of Just $280. https://t.co/dE5UmgIub2
@BrucePerens i got one and set it up in about 15 minutes. really nothing to it.
How the Roberts court decimated the Voting Rights Act. https://t.co/jbHAUVjsPZ
Does anyone have a contact at @snapchat that can provide a technical background on what they're doing with RSS. Thanks in advance. https://t.co/CGTH5AGsLE
It's been almost 20 years since RSS was refreshed. https://t.co/yb9PlwPeAj
Sources Go Direct, explained. https://t.co/hap4vAMjfh
@holden I did the experiment, I had to go back to get local sports. As far as I can tell, the cable systems have a monopoly here.

@KarlBode @TaylorLorenz Sources go direct now. Journalists play a role in that connection, but it's no longer exclusive as it once was. That's what the NYT management doesn't know. They should've been twitter.
@jenniej23 you win the prize
@rosa Wow, there it is hiding in plain sight. Thank you. ;-) https://t.co/RX6siTf0kr

One of the reasons we need a standard way of posting to the web is that Instagram still, after all these years, requires you to use a phone to post to it. If they supported a standard (which doesn't exist btw) then I could post from any editor that supported the standard.
Wordle 298 3/6 ‚¨ú‚¨úüü®‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨ú‚¨úüü©‚¨úüü® üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©
@molly0xFFF @cdixon @reckless We can use twitters namespace. I like twitters api. Works great. No need to build a new city.

Elon Musk on avoiding anti-aging research: 'I am not afraid of dying.' https://t.co/Td1e9fX6pc
Everyone is afraid of dying, it‚Äôs an evolutionary advantage. Animals who weren‚Äôt afraid to die, died.
That said, @elonmusk is right. We should accept our fate. Live an ordinary life. It‚Äôs the contradiction all billionaires must face. They‚Äôre still human.
@rushkoff I don‚Äôt know, let‚Äôs find out! üèåüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
In Call Before Jan. 6 Riot, a Plea to ‚ÄòDescend on the Capitol‚Äô. #gift https://t.co/YrfjSpn81z
@gruber An amazing product.

I like the way all the Web3 people put .eth after their names on Twitter. I am using .rss because however weird it might seem, RSS is due for a bounce-back, it's got a strong foundation, and it has a simpler mission than the crypto folk -- simply, to get news to the people.

@lucianadrian Did you happen to see that there is a link in the tweet that you replied to? You will find some of the information you seek by clicking on the link! It‚Äôs really really really really easy. You can do it!!
Putin Wants to Break NATO. Republicans Want to Help Him. https://t.co/r57nGLmmjx
